column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=In your book Making Kind Choices you have a chapter on bees .
#Text=Have you been following the recent development on the ‘ Rapture of the Bees ? ’
#Text=It ’s fascinating .
#Text=What do you think is happening with the bees ?
#Text=They think it ’s a virus or a bacteria , do n’t they ?
#Text=That ’s the thing : they ca n’t find any bee bodies .
#Text=Millions and millions have disappeared .
#Text=It ’s always fascinating how animals go off somewhere to die .
#Text=You do n’t see a lot of dead birds anyway and there are birds in this city .
#Text=I do n’t know .

#Text=Years and years ago I had not thought at all about bees and I went to a conference in upstate New York and there was a wonderful , gentle woman named Nermin Buyukmihci who talked about how violent bee keeping is .
#Text=I never thought about or known about this .
#Text=In your book she calls them ‘ honeystealers ’
#Text=She talked about the wire brush tearing off the wings and the smoking out .
#Text=I thought it was fascinating that she could even care about bees .

#Text=I thought to myself , “ Well they make this honey and they make propolis and everything else for their own nourishment and typical we come stomping along and take it all for ourselves , give them cheap sugar and smoke them out and kill them . ”
#Text=I thought that I do n’t need honey .
#Text=It was just another thing where you think , “ Why do I need this ? ”
#Text=Religion and animals
#Text=The Bible talks about humans as custodians of the Earth , and the religious community is beginning to awaken to the notion that this means they need to be involved on environmental issues .
#Text=What is the religious community ’s relationship to animal welfare ?

#Text=I think religion has departed so far from its origins that if you look at the root of all the large religions — Christianity , Judaism , Islam — that you find there is always an admonishment to be kind to animals .
#Text=The Chief Rabbi of Israel says no one should wear fur , for example .
#Text=There are other rabbis who say you can not keep kosher if you do n’t keep away from eating meat .
#Text=In Christianity , being aware of the smallest sparrow who will fall —
#Text=" You look at the Garden of Eden and that was a place where the lion lays down with the lamb and there is no slaughter . "
#Text=Sam Brownback raised that exact same quote in my interview with him , that God cares even when the smallest sparrow falls —
#Text=Yes !
#Text=Compassion !
#Text=I think people have departed .
#Text=Look at the Ten Commandments .
#Text=How many people in organized religion abide by the commandments ?
#Text=They lie , cheat and steal ; covet their neighbors ’ wives .
#Text=The fundamental root of religion is to be kind , compassionate , understanding ; to reach out to others .

#Text=Religion is often a big business , but there are some people like the Reverend Andrew Lindsay in the U.K. who conducts animal rights lectures , and there are people in this country who are speaking out to say we need to consider the animals , but I think it is difficult .
